com.stephengware.java.ai.planning

Class Search

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stephengware.java.ai.planning.Search

  • public abstract class Search
extends java.lang.Object
    A search is the process of exploring some space while looking for solutions to a problem. There are many different kinds of search spaces. Note that if a search space contains any solutions it probably contains many solutions, so this class provides ways to get one solution after another.
    Author:
    Stephen G. Ware

        public abstract int countVisited()

      • countExpanded

        public abstract int countExpanded()
        Returns the total number of nodes that have been expanded in this search since it was created.
        Returns:
        the number of expanded ndoes

      • setNodeLimit

        public abstract void setNodeLimit(int limit)
        Imposes a limit on the number of nodes that can be visited. During the search process, if more than this number of nodes are visited, the search will throw an exception. Note that this limit disregards the number of nodes visited so far. For example, if this method is called with a limit to 10, the next search that occurs can visit as many as 10 nodes (no matter how many have been visited by past searches).
        Parameters:
        limit - the maximum number of nodes to search

      • findNextSolution

        public abstract Plan findNextSolution()
        Searches the space until the next solution is found.
        Returns:
        the solution found
